results.title: The Queenslander: tales of the tropical north
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
When you leave Brisbane on the Queenslander, you find yourself on an adventure that seems larger than life. It’s a glorious luxury holiday train, reminiscent of the exotic rail journeys of last century. And there’s plenty of time to be drawn into it. The journey takes the better part of two days, travelling over 1,000 miles up the tropical coast to Cairns in the far north of Queensland. Pass through lush forests, unusual peaks and tiny towns, pineapple and banana plantations, grazing cattle and miles of sugarcane. Meet travellers from all over the world, including young backpackers, families on holiday and wealthy tourists, each with their own perspective on the Australian experience.

results.title: The Queen, the chef, and the president
results.brief_description: During Prince Edward Island’s centennial celebrations one of the places visited by Queen Elizabeth II was the tiny pioneer Acadian village of Mount Carmel, restored as part of a winter works project. This film records many amusing sidelights before and during the visit, as villagers did what they could to make sure that everything - lunch in a newly built restaurant, entertainment on an outdoor platform - went smoothly.

results.title: The Queen Returns
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness Prince Phillip to Australia. Much of the film is devoted to Canberra and its history as the Queen’s visit coincided with Canberra’s Jubilee Celebrations.

results.title: The Queen opens parliament
results.brief_description: This film describes the 1957 opening of Parliament in detail and explains the significance of each part of the ceremony as Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, in her capacity as Canada’s constitutional monarch, convenes the twenty-third session of Parliament.

results.title: The Queen of Sheba
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Strange and dramatic pages from the lives of the world’s most famous women. The Queen of Sheba having heard of King Solomon’s wisdom, travels across the desert to Jerusalem to meet him. The journey is one of the greatest overland journeys in history. On her arrival, the King greets her with majestic splendour, cordiality and hospitality. After a six-month stay, the Queen decides to return home. Following a sumptuous banquet in her honour, King Solomon tricks the Queen and satisfies his lust for this woman of great beauty and deep intelligence. The Queen of Sheba returns home and gives birth to a son. King Soloman never sees the Queen again but does finally meet his 16 yeaer old son, who later becomes the King of Abyssinia.

results.title: The Queen mother : 90 glorious years
results.brief_description: This video traces the extraordinary life of Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother using archival film and photographs. There is an interview with Princess Margaret, reminiscences from the Queen, recreations of her childhood, her wedding, the unforeseen Coronation and her tours around the world. Following the death of the King and the Coronation of a new Queen, she has continued to play a full part in the Elizabethan age, pursuing her duties with energy and warmth, and smiling her way into the hearts of people everywhere.

results.title: The Queen in Scotland
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: A review of Royal visits to Scotland during 1960. Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, and HRH Prince Philip touring the Western Isles, attending the Braemar Games, and Prince Andrew, Princess Ann and Prince Charles at Balmoral Castle. At Perth, Her Majesty inaugurates a road bridge, and at Kincardine she opens the new generating station. A visit to the Royal Highland Show precedes closing scenes in Edinburgh. Compiled by Riddell Black. Spoken by Tom Fleming.

results.title: The Queen in Germany
results.creator_credit: Ulrich Weidmann, Manfred Purzer and Cinecentrum
results.brief_description: The visit of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh was a token of reconciliation between Britain and Germany. Shows the official welcome at Bonn, by the Federal President; journey by steamer up the Rhine; a performance of Die Rosenkavalier in Munich; inspection of the British garrison in Berlin; a farewell dinner on the Royal Yacht Britannia before departing from Hamburg. Narrated by George Vine.

results.title: The Queen in Canada, 1964
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Nicholas Balla and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A hundred years earlier, the Fathers of Confederation gathered in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, to discuss the idea of a united Canada. In October, 1964, Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh came to commemorate that event and the conference at Quebec City that followed it.
